image.altText: Woman holding and looking at a glass of water in a kitchen.

props.synopsis: In a regional town just a few hours from Adelaide, an ongoing water crisis means the locals and their animals won't drink the tap water — yet residents are paying the same rates as residents in the city.

title.children: 'It destroys everything': The Australian town with undrinkable, salty and corrosive tap water

image.altText: Close up photo of Derek Bromley as a middle-aged man, wearing blue cap and blue shirt, smiling.

props.synopsis: In 1984 Derek Bromley was convicted of murdering Adelaide man Stephen Docoza, a crime Bromley has always denied committing. This month brings fresh hope to him and his advocates.

title.children: During the day Derek uses his firefighting experience to help his community. At night, he returns to his prison cell

image.altText: An image of an outdoor mall.

props.synopsis: A staff member at a sports store in Adelaide's Rundle Mall is taken to hospital and the shop is temporarily closed after an alleged assault by a teenager.

title.children: Teen to face court over alleged assault of worker in Adelaide sports store

image.altText: A woman in a dress with African print and a headress holds her arms aloft

props.synopsis: After a worryingly busy 2023 event, and in the midst of controversy, WOMADelaide still shines thanks to its artists and their stories.

title.children: Despite heatwaves and controversy, WOMADelaide still delivers on its most vital element

image.altText: A man is seen bleeding from his head while emergency services are on board

props.synopsis: Passengers describe an incident on a flight from Sydney to Auckland when a Boeing Dreamliner experienced a technical fault and dropped suddenly, with passengers being "thrown out of their seats".

title.children: 'Mass chaos broke out': The moments after the LATAM Airlines flight to NZ suddenly lost altitude

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: An illustration of a woman unable to sleep at night

props.synopsis: An oppressive heatwave over the south-eastern part of the country has felled temperature records and while autumn is no stranger to hot weather, experts say what we're seeing is part of a growing trend.

title.children: The real risk behind this record-breaking autumn heatwave and what we can expect in the future

image.altText: An elderly couple is seen in Melbourne, with a walking stick and umbrealla.

props.synopsis: A taskforce reviewing funding for aged care has rejected the idea of a tax levy to cover the sector's costs and instead suggested Australians accessing care should pay more based on their personal wealth.

title.children: Taskforce rejects aged care levy, pointing to demographic change and intergenerational equity

image.altText: A man in a blue suit holds an envelope in his left hand.

props.synopsis: Al Pacino and an Oscars producer address the confusion caused by the Godfather star reading out the Best Picture winner but not mentioning any of the other nominees.

title.children: Oscars producer apologises for Best Picture slip-up and Kimmel reveals he was told not to mention Trump

image.altText: A close up of two inconsistences in a photo

props.synopsis: The stakes of a Princess Catherine photo could not have been higher amid a swirl of speculation. But instead of avoiding a media storm, the House of Windsor is now caught up in a hurricane of coverage, with no certainty about when it will blow over, writes Rebecca Armitage and Lucia Stein.

title.children: Kate and William made two choices that turned their PR nightmare into an unmitigated disaster

image.altText: Prince William and Princess Catherine, wearing a suit and a red dress, stand waiting to welcome a dignitary

props.synopsis: The Princess of Wales responds to speculation over inconsistencies in a photo published to the royals' social media channels to mark Mother's Day in the UK.

title.children: Princess of Wales apologises over royal photoshop fail, saying she 'experimented with editing'

image.altText: Narendra Modi looks directly into camera while wearing rimless glasses and a beige stole

props.synopsis: One of the most powerful people in the world, Narendra Modi is running for a rare third term as India's prime minister. But much of his life has been shrouded in mystery. These hidden chapters tell the true story.

title.children: Modi spruiks himself as a single man, but in a humble home in rural India lives his secret wife

image.altText: A generic image of a carer crouching down and pointing next to a man who is using a wheelchair.

props.synopsis: Three years after a bruising royal commission exposed substandard care leading to neglect and abuse in nursing homes, elderly Australians may be asked to fork out more money than ever before, writes Anne Connolly.

title.children: Baby boomers will be asked to fork out more than ever under controversial aged care reforms

image.altText: Image shows congestion and traffic delays. You can see cars, grey road on a gloomy day.

props.synopsis: Amongst the furore and fallout among car manufacturers and Australia's new emissions laws, a separate split is developing over EV technology that could determine the future of our new critical minerals quest, writes Ian Verrender.

title.children: Will battery innovation kill the critical minerals boom?

image.altText: Forensics police on a street.

props.synopsis: Detectives say a man who was shot dead outside his home in Greenvale early this morning was known to police, but will not say whether the incident is linked to organised crime.

title.children: Family member treated for shock after man shot dead outside Melbourne home

image.altText: Aerial image of flood water surrounding Rawlinna Station after a storm passed over the Nullarbor

props.synopsis: Vital east-west road and rail links expected to remain closed for up to five days as drought-breaking storms hit the Nullarbor Plain.

title.children: Flooding cuts Australia's only cross-country railway line, as drought-breaking storms hit the Nullarbor Plain

props.synopsis: After blazing its way through awards season, the blockbuster biopic Oppenheimer took home the most Oscar trophies this year, including Best Picture. Here's how it ranks among the top Oscar-winning films of all time.

title.children: Oppenheimer dominated the 2024 Academy Awards. But did it break the record for most Oscar wins of all time?

image.altText: Spencer Leniu

props.synopsis: Spencer Leniu says racial slurs are common among players of diverse backgrounds, as NRL legend Johnathan Thurston hits out at Leniu's eight week ban.

title.children: 'All those types of words are used': Leniu says racial slurs are common, as Thurston hits out at ban

image.altText: a collapsed burned-out unit

props.synopsis: A body is found in the fire-ravaged home of an 83-year-old man after a blaze at a Burpengary retirement community.

title.children: Retirement village residents broke windows, tried to force open door to save 83yo trapped in burning home

image.altText: A food truck bogged on the side of a dirt road.

props.synopsis: Rising temperatures and extreme weather events will heap even more stress on sectors already under severe strain unless effective mitigation strategies are developed, according to the government's climate risk assessment report.

title.children: Health, finance and infrastructure threatened by changing climate, federal report warns

image.altText: A small baby in an incubator connected to tubes and their hand clutched around someones finger.

props.synopsis: A 19-year-old mother who watched her first baby die believes her concerns were disregarded by Mackay hospital staff, an experience bearing a striking resemblance to a case revealed at the hospital's last damning investigation in 2022.

title.children: Young mother who lost her newborn says hospital staff didn't listen because of her age

image.altText: A close up looking over the shoulder of a woman using her mobile phone on the platform of the train station.

props.synopsis: As Australia's 3G networks are retired, 4G phones without VoLTE and some regional customers are likely to be impacted.

title.children: Your 4G phone could be impacted by 3G shutdowns this year. Here's what to know

image.altText: Marles, wearing a sport jacket labelled 'Korea', shakes hands with a man in a suit, both smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: A former South Korean defence minister implicated in a corruption investigation over the death of a soldier has arrived in Australia to take up his controversial appointment as ambassador.

title.children: Diplomatic headache as Korean ambassador flies into Australia despite local corruption probe

image.altText: A Ukrainian solider holds a gun while looking at the camera. In the background, several soldiers are climbing on to a truck

props.synopsis: Ukraine's president Volodymyr Zelenskyy has suggested a counteroffensive may be launched this year. But to plan, prepare and execute such a strategy will be an enormous undertaking with three key challenges, writes Mick Ryan.

title.children: Ukraine is planning a counteroffensive against Russia. Can it succeed?

image.altText: Young protesters hold signs and yell while raising their fists at a protest

props.synopsis: The Indian government moves to implement legislation that fast-tracks naturalisation for people who have fled from Afghanistan, Bangladesh and Pakistan but excludes Muslims from the countries.

title.children: India moves to implement citizenship law that excludes Muslims

image.altText: A man looks at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Australia's share market edges up after Wall Street's major stock indices tracked sideways overnight. US investors are awaiting key February inflation data, to be released later tonight local time. Follow today's market news on our live blog.

title.children: ASX edges up, ex-RBA governor Philip Lowe to become Future Generation chair

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ACCC plans to extend wholesale prices to fixed-line broadband networks
Former central bank governor Philip Lowe speaks on The Business

image.altText: World War II veteran Harold Terens, 100, right, and Jeanne Swerlin, 96 snuggle on the couch during an interview

props.synopsis: Harold Terens and his fiancee Jeanne Swerlin might be in their 100s and 90s but the couple kiss and hold hands like high school sweethearts.

title.children: American World War II veteran, 100, to marry sweetheart near D-Day beaches

image.altText: Two men stand outside in farming paddock, one wears a cap and another a hat.

props.synopsis: For one of the most successful footballers of the modern era, farming provides the perfect relief to the high-pressured environment of elite sport.

title.children: How AFL superstar Tom Hawkins balances family, farming and football

image.altText: two men lounge on an inflatable bed in the middle of a dusty outdoor dancefloor

props.synopsis: Extreme heat, a suspected overdose death, and an abandoned festival. Ravers don't know what to make of Pitch 2024 after a confusing and sweltering Labor Day weekend in Victoria's west, with climate scientists forecasting more cancellations to come.

title.children: Festivals in the firing line after horror weekend of heat, suspected drug overdose death, cancellations

image.altText: Seven young people holding big yellow letters that spell out 'Heywire' and jumping on grass in front of parliament house

props.synopsis: Here are six ideas to improve the lives of young people living in regional Australia, according to 31 winners of the ABC's Heywire competition who travelled to Canberra from across the country to share their ideas for change.

title.children: Young people come up with six major projects to improve their lives in regional Australia

image.altText: Ferrari Formula One driver Felipe Massa of Brazil attends a news conference

props.synopsis: Former Ferrari driver Felipe Massa takes action against Formula 1, former commercial supremo Bernie Ecclestone and the governing FIA, seeking recognition as 2008 world champion and financial compensation.

title.children: Massa takes F1, FIA to court over claims he should be 2008 world champion

image.altText: a young man drinking a beer at the pub

props.synopsis: A Redbank Plains man has faced court charged with the murder of 21-year-old Will Swinbourne following an extensive manhunt on the Gold Coast.

title.children: Man allegedly stabbed to death with kitchen knife in Gold Coast car park during drug deal gone wrong, police say

image.altText: A graphic showing a artistic impression of a red-coloured dead mouse lying on its back in front of prison bars.

props.synopsis: As the Northern Territory's prison population reaches record levels, two former inmates from opposite ends of the territory speak out about the "dehumanising" conditions inside NT jails.

title.children: Dead mice and overcrowding: Former inmates describe 'dehumanising' life inside NT prisons

image.altText: An elderly man with grey hair and wearing a grey suit surrounded by police

props.synopsis: The 88-year-old, who has been held in a prison for "mentally abnormal" inmates, had argued he no longer posed a threat.

title.children: Austrian court overturns decision to transfer Josef Fritzl to regular prison
